info.title: Involved Party Management APIs
info.description: A group of services that relate to the creation and management of an involved party's details

Additional-Info.name: X-Additional-Info
Additional-Info.description:
This object holds information in addition to the other header fields below. The strings should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows; ["ProcessID 123456789", "ParentProcessID 66213"]. Name value pair is separated by a blank space character. Name must not contain a space but the value may contain. The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the name and  the second for the value. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

Channel.name: X-Channel
Channel.description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessTransactionCommunicationChannelCode' for the  list of possible values. Sample Values include POST OFFICE INTERNET MOBILE

Channel-Alternate-Id.name: X-Channel-Alternate-Id
Channel-Alternate-Id.description:
This string holds the channel alternate identifiers. It contains sub-strings that should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows. 'name value' for example ["MACHINEID 123.123.123.123", "CUSTOMERID 1234567891"]. The following values are allowed for name CASHIERID CUSTOMERID EMPLOYEEID MACHINEID TERMINALID USERID FUNCTIONALUNITID The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the type and  the second for the identifier. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

Virtual-Environment.name: X-Virtual-Environment
Virtual-Environment.description:
Where a project shares environments with other projects, this field is used to create a
"virtual environment". Consumers can pass this such that the service gateway routes to
a project specific version.  The main purpose of this field is to aid testing and
production proving.  Once the service is live and proven, it typically no longer serves
a purpose.
Example value "EM2DAY2".

Schema-Version.name: X-Schema-Version
Schema-Version.description:
This is a way for the consumer to communicate what version of the specification it has. For example a consumer may still operate using v1.0 while the service is at v1.1 (at which point "v1.1" will be added to the enumeration above). This field is used for two purposes
  - it will allow the service to ensure the consumer receives a
  compatible response
  - we can deploy a new minor version alongside an existing minor
  version, and route
  the service to either based on this field (and other info). Based
  on testing proving the service will ultimately switch to the 
  final version.

Journey-Id.description: A unique identifier populated by the consumer. It follows the UUID pattern, for example 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000

Source-System-Id.description:
Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessSystemID' for the  list of 
possible values. Sample

Create-Date-Time.description: Time stamp associated with creation of the request message utilisting the UTC ISO 8601 Date Time format.  "For example 2017-01-01T00:00:00 or 2017-01-01T00:00:00.001Z"

Validation-Token.description: Bespoke JWT validation token that allows calling the service. It also contains attributes to be validated against some parameters passed in the body to avoid tampering

moreProcessing.name: moreProcessing
moreProcessing.description:
This will be populated if there are more records to be updated for
name details in continuation with previous call for a particular
Involved Party ID.

Behaviour.description: Instruction to the BPM app support team to advise next steps for this Process Instance. This will not always be returned.

OverallSecurityLevel.description: Maximum severity level of the stack.

Code.description: Used by service consumers to define the error handling code. Each interface specification specifies which errors this service can return.

Description.description: Description associated with code, providing a summary of code meaning.

Source.description: Source component for this error - e.g. Service Operation or Process.

Severity.description: Severity level. A critical error requires further data remediation - e.g. in the Systems of Record.

Category.description: Further categorisation. OUTCOMEUNKNOWN/PARTIALFAILURE/TIMEOUT may require data integrity investigation.

Context.description: Original stack element, typically the error response from a System of Record.

errors.description: This block wraps either field level error or the error returned by the provider service and returned as a custom error. In case of multiple service invocation failure, all error will be wrapped and return for consumer to make decision and compose more meaningful message as desired.

Error.description: Error code and message will be used to communicate failure to consumer. This block provides the ability to create internal error code and message communicating the causes of the error. Validation errors for GET, PUT, PATCH and POST requests will need a field breakdown. This is best modelled by using an error code for validation failures and providing the detailed errors message in error message field.

code.description: A custom error code returned by the API for the consumer interested in fine-grained error handling. In the case where HTTP response code is too generic to provide specific treatment by the consumer, custom code can be used to handle specific error condition based on the provider services error condition. For example UI might want to show list of field error by name. Each interface specification specifies which errors this API can return.

message.description: It provides information application-specific errors returned by provider service or description of class of error returned by the API for example validation error.

logErrorId.description: An unique reference for every error being logged.

put.description: This service takes in data related to an Individual and updates data related to them

parameters.description: Updates the details of an involved party

involvedPartySoftLock.description: involvedPartySoftLock is a reference number to identify the record for an involved party. This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response

prefixTitle.title: Prefix title
prefixTitle.description: This is the customer title. Values dervied from TMSII View No. 247

initials.title: Intials
initials.description: This is the customer name initials

suffixTitle.title: Suffix Title
suffixTitle.description: This is the customers honorific, i.e. BSc. Values dervied from TMSII table No. 48

preferredName.title: Preferred Name
preferredName.description: This is the customers name which they prefer to be addressed by

birthDate.title: Birth Date
birthDate.description: This is a customers date of birth: Uses the UTC ISO 8601 Date Date format. For example 2017-01-01

maritalStatus.title: Marital Status
maritalStatus.description: Marital status of customer. Values from TMSII View No. 146 - InvvdPtyIndivMaritalStatus

numberOfDependents.title: Number of Dependents
numberOfDependents.description: Count of dependents that a customer has

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: Gender of Customer. Values from TMSII View No. 140 - Invvd Pty Indiv Gender

accessibilityNeeds.title: Accessability Needs
accessibilityNeeds.description: Particular Needs of a customer. Values from TMS Table No. 484 - Particular Needs

citizenshipCountryCode.title: Nationality
citizenshipCountryCode.description: National registration of involved party. Values from TMSII View No. 350 - Invvd Pty Indiv Nationality 1

deceasedStatus.title: Deceased Status
deceasedStatus.description: Death indicator of customer. Values from TMSII Table 46 - Invvd Pty Indiv Death Indicator

deceasedDate.title: Deceased Date
deceasedDate.description: This is a customer date of death: Uses the UTC ISO 8601 Date Date format. For example 2017-01-01

countryOfBirth.title: Country Of Birth
countryOfBirth.description: Country of birth of involved party.  Values from CIS table AA020.

faceToFace.title: Face to Face Indicator
faceToFace.description: Face to Face preference of customer

membershipStatusCode.title: Membership Status Code
membershipStatusCode.description: Invovled Party membership status value. Please refre TMS Table No. 644 – IndividualMembershipCode

membershipVoluntaryIndicator.title: Membership Voluntary Indicator
membershipVoluntaryIndicator.description: Voluntary Indicator for membership . True – Voluntary Indicator has been set, False -  Otherwise

membershipOverrideIndicator.title: Membership Override Indicator
membershipOverrideIndicator.description: Override Indicator for membership.Enumerations defined as All products (including Portman), and NBS products only

doNotMergeIndicator.title: Merge Indicator
doNotMergeIndicator.description: Indicates if record should be merged with similar record or not

tssRegisteredInd.title: TSS Registered Indicator
tssRegisteredInd.description: Telephone Banking Registration Status. TSS (Telephone Self Service)

idCheckStatusCode.title: Identification Check Status Code
idCheckStatusCode.description: Identification Check Status Code. Values from TMSII Table No. 508 - IdentificationCheckStatusCode

contactPreferences.description: Holds the list of contact preferences of an involved party (individual or organisation).

accountsForAddressChange.description:
The list of accounts whose correspondance address will be changed.
At a time up to a maximum of 50 acounts can be processed.
The consumer is expected to invoke this service multiple times when more than 50 accounts need to be processed sending upto a maximum of 50 accounts per invocation.
Note - This input is specific to Exception Change of Address.

accountSoftLock.title: Account SoftLock
accountSoftLock.description: The Agreement Blob as defined by CIS.

moreProcessing.title: More Processing
moreProcessing.description: This represents if there are further agreements for which the address needs to change. This is Mandatory input to next call if output by previous call to SC03(Standard Change of Address) - indicates that not all accounts have been moved

contactPointSoftLock.title: CP SoftLock
contactPointSoftLock.description: This is reference to contact point within CIS. It is combination of contact point reference number and update level. Populate this if user has  searched/selected existing contact point for the customer.  This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response Used only to set existing address as the correspondence address

contactPointEndDate.title: CP End Date
contactPointEndDate.description: contact Point Role end Date. After this date contact point will not be effective.

contactPointStartDate.title: CP Start Date
contactPointStartDate.description: contact Point Role Start Date on which contact point will be effective

contactPointOccupancyStatusCode.title: Role Occupancy Status Code
contactPointOccupancyStatusCode.description: Occupancy Status of the contact point.  e.g. - Owner Occupier, Private Tenant etc. Please refer to TMS Table 194 forvalues

contactPointUsage.description: Usage of contact point a.k.a Communication Point Role Type. e.g Correspondence Address, Residential Address etc. Please refer to TMS view 250 for code/values.This field must be presented for all Communication Points updates.

contactPointTelephoneNumber.title: Telephone Number
contactPointTelephoneNumber.description: Details related to a Fixedline or Mobile number. For GET all fields are available, however for PUT/POST a consumer can only populate localNumber, areaCode and extensionNumber,countryPhoneCode If exists. For UK Phone numbers, the Phone number need to be passed into two part assigning into areaCode and localNumber.

standaloneAddressIndicator.title: Standalone Address Indicator
standaloneAddressIndicator.description: Standalone or hanging address ( The postal address of an Involved Party which is NOT associated to any agreements )  True- Standalone address set, False -  Oherwise.This field must be presented for all Communication Points updates. Only applicable to to postal addresses

contactPointManualEntryReasonCode.title: CP Manual Entry Reason Code
contactPointManualEntryReasonCode.description: Reason for not selecting address from search and entering address manually. Please refer TMSII Table No. 21 - Comcn Pnt Validity Reason for code/ values. Only applicable to postal addresses

contactPointAddressComponent.title: Postal Address
contactPointAddressComponent.description: Contains an address types and address information populated by data available. Consumer should check to see if BFPO is populate to find type of address. If BFPO is given use fields addressLine1 and and below. Else use other fields except in the case of foreign addresses, where consumer would also use addressLine1 to addressLine3 in addition to the country

postalCode.title: Postal Code
postalCode.description: Postal code of the address. This includes Inward and Outward post codes, both

addressLine1.title: Address Line 1
addressLine1.description: First line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be unit/regiment

addressLine2.title: Address Line 2
addressLine2.description: Second line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be BFPO Number

addressLine3.title: Address Line 3
addressLine3.description: Third line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be set as BFPO

addressLine4.title: Address Line 4
addressLine4.description: Fourth line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be Staff number, rank and name

addressLine5.title: Address Line 5
addressLine5.description: Fifth line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be Operation/location name (optional)

pafStatus.title: PAF Status
pafStatus.description: Values expressing the PAF state of an address.The values are PAF_Address-Address on PAF,PAF_Overriden-Address on PAF but overridden,Non_PAF_Address-Address not on PAF

deliveryPointSuffix.title: Delivery Point Suffix
deliveryPointSuffix.description: The DPS is a two character identifier, e.g. 2B which when added to the Postcode gives a unique delivery point identifier to a live delivery point. Once the delivery point is deleted from PAF the DPS may be reused. The DPS for a Large User is always '1A' as each Large User has its own Postcode.

poBoxNumber.title: PO Box Number
poBoxNumber.description: po box number of postal address

contactPointRoleSoftLock.title: CP Role SoftLock
contactPointRoleSoftLock.description: contact point role softlock is the reference to conatc point role. contact point role links involved party with contact point.  This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response

contactPointRoleAddressPrefix.title: Communication Point Role Address Prefix
contactPointRoleAddressPrefix.description: Address Prefix Contains info on items such as POA

contactPointUnavailableReason.title: Role Unavailability Reason
contactPointUnavailableReason.description: Reason for unavailability of contact point. e.g. No Trace, No Mail etc. Please refer to TMS Table 18 for code/values

contactPointMailingAddressIndicator.title: Mailing Address Indicator
contactPointMailingAddressIndicator.description: Indicates if contact point is a mailing address. Set to true if contact point is preferred mailing address.

taxDetails.description: A list of taxation and FATCA data

selfCertDeclaration.title: Self Cert Declaration
selfCertDeclaration.description: AKA self-dicationDeclaration field.   B=Customer required to declare D=Customer has declaration.  Meaning of value can be taken from TMS 1153, SelfCertifot answered N=Non UK citizen and/or pay tax outside of UK X=Not Required Y=Only a UK citizen and only resident in the UK for tax purposes Space=Individual with no in scope products

selfCertDate.title: Self Cert Date
selfCertDate.description: As defined by full-date - RFC3339 YYYY-MM-DD

taxType.title: Tax type
taxType.description: Tax type. Possible values R = Residential C = Citizenship D = Not Asked

declineReasonCode.description:
Reason code for non-capture of self certification
declaration

have been successfully moved and accounts that can not be moved.

get.description: This service operation is used to retrieve customer details from the Customer Information System (CIS). The involved party number will be passed as the input and the response will be details of the customer such as Name, “Best” Address, ID Status, etc. This data will be returned to the consuming service unfiltered.

parameters.name: X-Additional-Info
parameters.description:
This object holds information in addition to the other header fields below. The strings should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows; ["ProcessID 123456789", "ParentProcessID 66213"]. Name value pair is separated by a blank space character. Name must not contain a space but the value may contain. The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the name and  the second for the value. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

parameters.name: X-Channel
parameters.description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessTransactionCommunicationChannelCode' for the  list of possible values. Sample Values include POST OFFICE INTERNET MOBILE

parameters.name: X-Channel-Alternate-Id
parameters.description:
This string holds the channel alternate identifiers. It contains sub-strings that should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows. 'name value' for example ["MACHINEID 123.123.123.123", "CUSTOMERID 1234567891"]. The following values are allowed for name CASHIERID CUSTOMERID EMPLOYEEID MACHINEID TERMINALID USERID FUNCTIONALUNITID The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the type and  the second for the identifier. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

parameters.name: X-Virtual-Environment
parameters.description:
Where a project shares environments with other projects, this field is used to create a
"virtual environment". Consumers can pass this such that the service gateway routes to
a project specific version.  The main purpose of this field is to aid testing and
production proving.  Once the service is live and proven, it typically no longer serves
a purpose.
Example value "EM2DAY2".

parameters.name: X-Schema-Version
parameters.description:
This is a way for the consumer to communicate what version of the specification it has. For example a consumer may still operate using v1.0 while the service is at v1.1 (at which point "v1.1" will be added to the enumeration above). This field is used for two purposes
  - it will allow the service to ensure the consumer receives a
  compatible response
  - we can deploy a new minor version alongside an existing minor
  version, and route
  the service to either based on this field (and other info). Based
  on testing proving the service will ultimately switch to the 
  final version.

post.description: This service accepts a 'merge' block consisting of one survivor involved party details and a list of victim(duplicate) involved parties to merge with the survivor. It accepts a 'noMerge' block consisting of one involved party in context and a list of suspected duplicate involved parties that are 'no match' for the party in context. The service updates the survivor involved party details in system of record, merges the duplicate involved parties with the survivor and marks the suspect duplicates as 'no match' for the involved party in context.

parameters.description:
This object holds information in addition to the other header fields below. The strings should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows; ["ProcessID 123456789", "ParentProcessID 66213"]. Name value pair is separated by a blank space character. Name must not contain a space but the value may contain. The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the name and  the second for the value. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

parameters.description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessTransactionCommunicationChannelCode' for the  list of possible values. Sample Values include POST OFFICE INTERNET MOBILE

parameters.name: X-Channel-Alternate-Id
parameters.description:
This string holds the channel alternate identifiers. It contains sub-strings that should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows. 'name value' for example ["MACHINEID 123.123.123.123", "CUSTOMERID 1234567891"]. The following values are allowed for name CASHIERID CUSTOMERID EMPLOYEEID MACHINEID TERMINALID USERID FUNCTIONALUNITID The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the type and  the second for the identifier. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

parameters.name: X-Virtual-Environment
parameters.description:
Where a project shares environments with other projects, this field is used to create a
"virtual environment". Consumers can pass this such that the service gateway routes to
a project specific version.  The main purpose of this field is to aid testing and
production proving.  Once the service is live and proven, it typically no longer serves
a purpose.
Example value "EM2DAY2".

parameters.name: X-Schema-Version
parameters.description:
This is a way for the consumer to communicate what version of the specification it has. For example a consumer may still operate using v1.0 while the service is at v1.1 (at which point "v1.1" will be added to the enumeration above). This field is used for two purposes
  - it will allow the service to ensure the consumer receives a
  compatible response
  - we can deploy a new minor version alongside an existing minor
  version, and route
  the service to either based on this field (and other info). Based
  on testing proving the service will ultimately switch to the 
  final version.

prefixTitle.title: Prefix title
prefixTitle.description: This is the customer title. Values dervied from TMSII View No. 247

initials.title: Intials
initials.description: This is the customer name initials

suffixTitle.title: Suffix Title
suffixTitle.description: This is the customers honorific, i.e. BSc. Values dervied from TMSII table No. 48

preferredName.title: Preferred Name
preferredName.description: This is the customers name which they prefer to be addressed by

birthDate.title: Birth Date
birthDate.description: This is a customers date of birth: Uses the UTC ISO 8601 Date Date format. For example 2017-01-01

maritalStatus.title: Marital Status
maritalStatus.description: Marital status of customer. Values from TMSII View No. 146 - InvvdPtyIndivMaritalStatus

numberOfDependents.title: Number of Dependents
numberOfDependents.description: Count of dependents that a customer has

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: Gender of Customer. Values from TMSII View No. 140 - Invvd Pty Indiv Gender

accessibilityNeeds.title: Accessability Needs
accessibilityNeeds.description: Particular Needs of a customer. Values from TMS Table No. 484 - Particular Needs

citizenshipCountryCode.title: Nationality
citizenshipCountryCode.description: National registration of involved party. Values from TMSII View No. 350 - Invvd Pty Indiv Nationality 1

deceasedStatus.title: Deceased Status
deceasedStatus.description: Death indicator of customer. Values from TMSII Table 46 - Invvd Pty Indiv Death Indicator

deceasedDate.title: Deceased Date
deceasedDate.description: This is a customer date of death: Uses the UTC ISO 8601 Date Date format. For example 2017-01-01

countryOfBirth.title: Country Of Birth
countryOfBirth.description: Country of birth of involved party.  Values from CIS table AA020.

faceToFace.title: Face to Face Indicator
faceToFace.description: Face to Face preference of customer

membershipStatusCode.title: Membership Status Code
membershipStatusCode.description: Invovled Party membership status value. Please refre TMS Table No. 644 – IndividualMembershipCode

membershipVoluntaryIndicator.title: Membership Voluntary Indicator
membershipVoluntaryIndicator.description: Voluntary Indicator for membership . True – Voluntary Indicator has been set, False -  Otherwise

membershipOverrideIndicator.title: Membership Override Indicator
membershipOverrideIndicator.description: Override Indicator for membership.Enumerations defined as All products (including Portman), and NBS products only

doNotMergeIndicator.title: Merge Indicator
doNotMergeIndicator.description: Indicates if record should be merged with similar record or not

tssRegisteredInd.title: TSS Registered Indicator
tssRegisteredInd.description: Telephone Banking Registration Status. TSS (Telephone Self Service)

idCheckStatusCode.title: Identification Check Status Code
idCheckStatusCode.description: Identification Check Status Code. Values from TMSII Table No. 508 - IdentificationCheckStatusCode

contactPreferences.description: Holds the list of contact preferences of an involved party (individual or organisation).

contactPointSoftLock.title: CP SoftLock
contactPointSoftLock.description: This is reference to contact point within CIS. It is combination of contact point reference number and update level. Populate this if user has  searched/selected existing contact point for the customer.  This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response Used only to set existing address as the correspondence address

contactPointEndDate.title: CP End Date
contactPointEndDate.description: contact Point Role end Date. After this date contact point will not be effective.

contactPointStartDate.title: CP Start Date
contactPointStartDate.description: contact Point Role Start Date on which contact point will be effective

contactPointUsage.description: Usage of contact point a.k.a Communication Point Role Type. e.g Correspondence Address, Residential Address etc. Please refer to TMS view 250 for code/values.This field must be presented for all Communication Points updates.

contactPointTelephoneNumber.title: Telephone Number
contactPointTelephoneNumber.description: Details related to a Fixedline or Mobile number. For GET all fields are available, however for PUT/POST a consumer can only populate localNumber, areaCode and extensionNumber,countryPhoneCode If exists. For UK Phone numbers, the Phone number need to be passed into two part assigning into areaCode and localNumber.

contactPointRoleSoftLock.title: CP Role SoftLock
contactPointRoleSoftLock.description: contact point role softlock is the reference to conatc point role. contact point role links involved party with contact point.  This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response

contactPointRoleAddressPrefix.title: Communication Point Role Address Prefix
contactPointRoleAddressPrefix.description: Address Prefix Contains info on items such as POA

contactPointUnavailableReason.title: Role Unavailability Reason
contactPointUnavailableReason.description: Reason for unavailability of contact point. e.g. No Trace, No Mail etc. Please refer to TMS Table 18 for code/values

contactPointMailingAddressIndicator.title: Mailing Address Indicator
contactPointMailingAddressIndicator.description: Indicates if contact point is a mailing address. Set to true if contact point is preferred mailing address.

taxDetails.description: A list of taxation and FATCA data

selfCertDeclaration.title: Self Cert Declaration
selfCertDeclaration.description: AKA self-dicationDeclaration field.   B=Customer required to declare D=Customer has declaration.  Meaning of value can be taken from TMS 1153, SelfCertifot answered N=Non UK citizen and/or pay tax outside of UK X=Not Required Y=Only a UK citizen and only resident in the UK for tax purposes Space=Individual with no in scope products

selfCertDate.title: Self Cert Date
selfCertDate.description: As defined by full-date - RFC3339 YYYY-MM-DD

taxType.title: Tax type
taxType.description: Tax type. Possible values R = Residential C = Citizenship D = Not Asked

declineReasonCode.description:
Reason code for non-capture of self certification
declaration

moreProcessing.description: This represents if there are further agreements for which the address needs to change. Format: aaaabbbbbbbbbb (14) where: aaaa is the agreement role type (4) bbbbbbbbbb is the agreement reference number (10)

numberOfAccounts.description:
Number of accounts that have passed Member Profile
eligibility during Standard Change of Address and a move to a
new addr will be attempted.

moveAccountStatus.description:
This element represents the list of accounts/agreements which
have been successfully moved and accounts that have failed
member accounts eligibility and therefore can not be moved.

accountReference.description:
The external account number, account number the
customer knows.

source account system. Values derived from TMSII View
No. 257 - Agreement Element Location

put.summary: Update Correspondence address to all agreements for a Single Involved Party or Adds a new Involved Party address.
put.description: This service takes in Address details which need to be add/updated of an Involved Party.

parameters.name: X-Additional-Info
parameters.description:
This object holds information in addition to the other header fields below. The strings should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows; ["ProcessID 123456789", "ParentProcessID 66213"]. Name value pair is separated by a blank space character. Name must not contain a space but the value may contain. The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the name and  the second for the value. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

parameters.name: X-Channel
parameters.description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessTransactionCommunicationChannelCode' for the  list of possible values. Sample Values include POST OFFICE INTERNET MOBILE

parameters.name: X-Channel-Alternate-Id
parameters.description:
This string holds the channel alternate identifiers. It contains sub-strings that should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows. 'name value' for example ["MACHINEID 123.123.123.123", "CUSTOMERID 1234567891"]. The following values are allowed for name CASHIERID CUSTOMERID EMPLOYEEID MACHINEID TERMINALID USERID FUNCTIONALUNITID The values within the identifier should meet the criteria below
  string max length of 121 and pattern of
  ^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$
This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the type and  the second for the identifier. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

parameters.name: X-Virtual-Environment
parameters.description:
Where a project shares environments with other projects, this field is used to create a
"virtual environment". Consumers can pass this such that the service gateway routes to
a project specific version.  The main purpose of this field is to aid testing and
production proving.  Once the service is live and proven, it typically no longer serves
a purpose.
Example value "EM2DAY2".

parameters.name: X-Schema-Version
parameters.description:
This is a way for the consumer to communicate what version of the specification it has. For example a consumer may still operate using v1.0 while the service is at v1.1 (at which point "v1.1" will be added to the enumeration above). This field is used for two purposes
  - it will allow the service to ensure the consumer receives a
  compatible response
  - we can deploy a new minor version alongside an existing minor
  version, and route
  the service to either based on this field (and other info). Based
  on testing proving the service will ultimately switch to the 
  final version.

parameters.description: A unique identifier populated by the consumer. It follows the UUID pattern, for example 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000

parameters.name: X-Source-System-Id
parameters.description:

parameters.description: This service will update a Correspondence address to all agreements for a Single Member or Adds a new Member address.

involvedPartySoftLock.description: Involved Party SoftLock is a reference number to identify the record for an involved party. This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response.

moreProcessingSCOA.description: This represents if there are further agreements for which the address needs to change, and this is applicable to Standard Change of Address (SCOA).

contactPreferences.description: Holds the list of addresses of an involved party (individual or organisation).

accountsForAddressChange.description:
The list of accounts whose correspondance address will be changed.
At a time up to a maximum of 50 acounts can be processed.
The consumer is expected to invoke this service multiple times when more than 50 accounts need to be processed sending upto a maximum of 50 accounts per invocation.
Note - This input is specific to Exception Change of Address.

accountSoftLock.title: Account SoftLock
accountSoftLock.description: The Agreement Blob as defined by CIS.

contactPointSoftLock.description: Contact point soft lock used to make sure update is against to existing latest record, must retain and passed for updates.

contactPointEndDate.title: CP role End Date
contactPointEndDate.description: contact Point Role end Date. After this date contact point will not be effective

contactPointOccupancyStatusCode.title: Role Occupancy Status Code
contactPointOccupancyStatusCode.description: Role Occupancy Status Code.Please refer to TMS Table 194 for values

contactPointUsage.description: Communication Point Role Type.Please refer to TMS view 250 for values

standaloneAddressIndicator.title: Standalone Address Indicator
standaloneAddressIndicator.description: Standalone or hanging address ( The postal address of an Involved Party which is NOT associated to any agreements )  True – Standalone address set, False -  Oherwise

contactPointManualEntryReasonCode.description: Reason for not selecting address from search and entering address manually. Please refer TMSII Table No. 21 - Comcn Pnt Validity Reason for code/ values

contactPointAddressComponent.description:
Contains an address types and address information populated
by data available. Consumer should check to see if BFPO is
populate to find type of address. If BFPO is given use fields
addressLine1 and and below. Else use other fields except in
the case of foreign addresses, where consumer would also use
addressLine1 to addressLine3 in addition to the country

postalCode.description: This includes Inward and Outward post codes, both

addressLine1.title: Address Line 1
addressLine1.description: First line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be unit/regiment

addressLine2.title: Address Line 2
addressLine2.description: Second line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be BFPO Number

addressLine3.title: Address Line 3
addressLine3.description: Third line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be set as BFPO

addressLine4.title: Address Line 4
addressLine4.description: Fourth line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be Staff number, rank and name

addressLine5.title: Address Line 5
addressLine5.description: Fifth line of address or in the case of BFPO this will be Operation/location name (optional)

pafStatus.title: PAF Status
pafStatus.description:
Values expressing the PAF state of an address.The values
are PAF_Address-Address on PAF,PAF_Overriden-Address on
PAF but overridden,Non_PAF_Address-Address not on PAF

deliveryPointSuffix.description:
The DPS is a two character identifier, e.g. 2B which when
added to the Postcode gives a unique delivery point
identifier to a live delivery point. Once the delivery
point is deleted from PAF the DPS may be reused. The DPS
for a Large User is always '1A' as each Large User has
its own Postcode.

poBoxNumber.title: PO Box Number
poBoxNumber.description: po box number of postal address

contactPointRoleSoftLock.title: CP Role SoftLock
contactPointRoleSoftLock.description: contact point role softlock is the reference to conatc point role. contact point role links involved party with contact point.  This field must always be sourced from a previous CIS response

contactPointRoleAddressPrefix.title: Communication Point Role Address Prefix
contactPointRoleAddressPrefix.description: Address Prefix Contains info on items such as POA

contactPointUnavailableReason.title: Role Unavailability Reason
contactPointUnavailableReason.description: Reason for unavailability of contact point. e.g. No Trace, No Mail etc. Please refer to TMS Table 18 for code/values

contactPointMailingAddressIndicator.title: Mailing Address Indicator
contactPointMailingAddressIndicator.description: Indicates if contact point is a mailing address. Set to true if contact point is preferred mailing address.
